comment: Fourier series convergence for periodic, piecewise smooth functions. The series converges to the average value of the left and the right limit of the function. Thus, if the function is continuous at a given point, the series converges exactly to the function value, see ~ fouriercnp . Notice that for a piecewise smooth function, the left and right limits always exist, see ~ fourier2 for an alternative form of the theorem that makes this fact explicit. When the first derivative is continuous, a simpler version of the theorem can be stated, see ~ fouriercn . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
